titleStmt.title: Letter from Nancy Violette Cunningham to Eartha M. M. White. June 1, 1928.
titleStmt.author: Nancy Violette Cunningham

publicationStmt.p: This document forms part of the project "Editing the Earth M.M. White Collection" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

msContents.summary: Author writes to White discussing recent affairs at Christian conferences.

objectDesc.p: A single page typewritten letter from Nancy to White about church affairs, written on 6/1/1928. The letter has St. Benedict the Moor Mission's heading. It also has handwritten corrections throughout and the street address of a hospital in Milwaukee, Wisconsin written at the bottom.

editorialDecl.p: This file was transcribed and encoded according to the editorial criteria of the project "Editing the Eartha M.M. White Collection." Using the various options encoded within <choice> elements, this file enables the viewing of a diplomatic transcription and a regularized reading text.

opener.name:
St.Saint Benedict the Moor Mission
288-290 Tenth Street
Cor.Corner of State Street
Milwaukee, Wis.Wisconsin

body.p:
Honest to goodness I am ashameashamed to write you again
because you wontwon't answer my letters and I feel that
I am imposing on you to keep; on writing you, but I
will take a chance and write you again and trust to
the gods to get from you an answer for me.

I am hoping that you are well and getting along
alright in your buisinessbusiness. Are you coming up here to
the National BabptistBaptist Young Peoples' Convention the
last of this month?

Half way looked for you at the General Confer
ence although I know that you are no Methodist.
Every bodyEverybody was here and they did raise some sand as
is customary at such meetings.

One of the lawyers of this city no, Chicago I mean is suing Rev.Reverend Tooks
for $25,000.00 for slander. Poor Tooks thinks that
he is home there where he can talk about people and
bully it out with them but he will find out different.

With a new Bishop there I was thinking that I would
like to come down there and work this winter if I
could get a position there in Edward Waters College
similar to the one that I have here., Oror even Dean
of women,. Guess Grace will go with Bishop Hurst.
Have you heard whether she is going or not?

Find out what the possibilities are for getting
something like the above mentioned work and let me
know will you?

You are right on the ground there and can find
out in a day what I would be weeks finding out by writ
ing because they may be like you not inclined to writ
ing. Hope that you are O.K. and pleasewrite me soon.
Speak to D.D. Powell for me, about the work.
body.note:
320 - 10thtenth st.street
Milwaukee Wis.Wisconsin
This is the hospital no.number
and will come di
rectly to one.
